DOC.brief_summary: Pulsed dye laser (PDL) treatments have been suggested to be a safe and effective therapeutic approach for treating basal cell carcinomas. Robust supporting evidence is, however, lacking due to inconsistent design of available studies. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the PDL's efficacy and safety in treating superficial basal cell carcinoma (sBCC) at low risk anatomical sites in an evidence based study setting.
DOC.brief_title: Pulsed Dye Laser in Treating Superficial Basal Cell Carcinomas
DOC.criteria: histologically confirmed unpigmented sBCC on the trunk and extremities maximal tumour diameter 30 mm Fitzpatrick skin type >III pregnancy previous BCC treatment within 4 weeks coagulation disorders photo sensitizing medication any indication of poor compliance
